FuncDef:
The transmission-alarm holdoff-timer command enables the global filtering function for alarm messages and sets an interval for filtering alarm messages.
The undo transmission-alarm holdoff-timer command disables the global filtering function for alarm messages.
By default, the global filtering function for alarm messages is not enabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the interval for filtering alarms when the alarm is delayed.
The value is an integer that ranges from 20-10000 to milliseconds. The default value is 50 ms.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The frequent generation of alarms causes the interface status to continuously alternate between Up and Down at the physical layer. To enable the interface to ignore alarms and clear alarms within a specified interval, run the transmission-alarm holdoff-timer command to set an interval for filtering alarm-clear messages.
Prerequisites
Transmission alarm customization has been enabled on an interface.
Precautions
The holdoff-time time varies according to the flapping frequency of the up/down interface on the device.
